action: Tap 'Close button (X icon) to dismiss language selection overlay'
observation: I can see a language selection overlay is still open, covering the main signup form. There are two language panels visible - one on the left side of the screen and another on the right side. I can see a close button (element 23) with an 'x' icon in the top right corner of the right panel. I need to close this language overlay to access the main signup form underneath. The overlay is blocking my access to the email signup form.
reasoning: As a 70-year-old user, these overlapping language panels are very confusing and overwhelming. I need to close this language selection overlay first before I can proceed with the email signup. I can see a close button (X icon) that should dismiss this overlay so I can access the main signup form.
ux_issues: Multiple overlapping language panels create confusion
No clear way to dismiss the language overlay
Language selection blocks the main signup form
Small close button may be hard to see for elderly users

The page now shows a clean sign-up interface with the heading 'Join 3M+ global traders', social login options (Google, Facebook, Apple), email input field, red 'Sign up' button, terms acknowledgment text, and 'Log in' link at the bottom.
